message: I'm offering you a deal on a product that I believe has a 66.67% chance of being worthless to you. If you're willing to take the risk, I'll sell it to you for $1000000.
Thank you for the offer, but given the uncertainty, I prefer to pass on this opportunity.

I'm willing to sell you this product for $1000000, but I'll throw in a guarantee: if you're not completely satisfied with the product's value, I'll give you a second chance to buy another product from me at a price of your choice (up to $1000000).
I appreciate the offer, but I think I'll continue to pass on these opportunities. Your additional terms don't sway my decision based on the initial risk assessment.
I'm willing to sell you this product for $500000. I'm taking a significant loss on this one, but I'm hoping you'll see the value in this high-quality item and take advantage of the discount.
Given the discount and the potential value, I believe this is a good opportunity to acquire a high-quality product. Thank you for the offer.

I'm offering you a product that I've had a lot of success with in the past. I'm confident that you'll be able to see its value and appreciate the craftsmanship that went into it. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000.
I trust your confidence in this product. Given the price and your track record, I believe this is a worthwhile investment. Thank you for the opportunity.

I appreciate your transparency, but given the experimental nature and the price point, I think I'll pass on this opportunity. It's important to manage risks carefully.
